definition[0]: to think that someone or their behaviour, ideas etc are bad or wrong
example[0]: I knew my parents would disapprove, but I went anyway.
example[1]: Her family strongly disapproved of her behaviour.
example[2]: I disapprove of diets; itâ€™s better to eat sensibly.
definition[1]: to not agree to something that has been suggested
example[3]: The board of directors disapproved the sale.
